content.description: I really enjoy the crux on this one, you know, nice rock and fun movement, all that stuff. After the last bolt the holds/crystals are very sharp so be warned. Climb a tow of rock through a tricky section to a stance below the slanting crack. Fire through this crux section landing on the cave ledge. Clip a bolt but climb to its left and then reach out right to clip the anchor.
Get started then climb through a section of quartz that looks way easier than it is. After that cruiser climbing leads to the ledge and the Crystal Cave. You made it!

Rock hounds were among some of the explorers to have visited Russell in the past. Here they had discovered and to a small extent mined crystals from a cave feature on a ledge. I'm not sure how long this area had been known but I found a few relics in the cave and a newish five piece bolt on the ledge. Please leave the relics for future parties to 'discover' as well.There are a couple of good routes here but the main attraction is really the unique cave and history.
